verses.name: 2 Corinthians 3:9
verses.text: For if the ministration of condemnation be glory, much more doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.

verses.name: 2 Corinthians 3:10
verses.text: For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.

verses.name: 2 Corinthians 3:11
verses.text: For if that which is done away was glorious, much more that which remaineth is glorious.

verses.name: 2 Corinthians 3:12
verses.text: Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great plainness of speech:

verses.name: 2 Corinthians 3:13
verses.text: And not as Moses, which put a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:
